page.title: 07Transport - Roads
page.content: There is a dense network of good roads in Chertsey. Just outside the section is the M25 London Orbital Motorway giving fast connections with all routes from London. The nearest interchange with the M3, which runs to the north of the block, is at Thorpe. It leads west to Southampton and east to London. The M25 links the M3 with the A3 at Wisley. St. Peter's Way is a new road connecting Addlestone and Chertsey to the M25. Areas of congestion in the locality are at Chertsey Bridge and Hatch Farm Roundabout. Heriot Road has helped to relieve congestion in the Town Centre, as Sainsbury's car park has increased parking facilities and Guildford Street has been made a one-way street.
